alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 11:51PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rawlins and southern Hitchcock Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1150 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Stratton, or 11 miles southwest of Trenton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, dangerous cloud to ground lightning, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Rawlins and southern Hitchcock Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
